isis.stitle: TSI 01 12 12 - Flywheel Machining Dimensions and Guidelines

item.para: To avoid personal injury and possible death, this resurfacing procedure should be carried out by a skilled technician, using specialized equipment specifically for this function. Flywheel machining must be performed at a reputable servicing location.

Flywheel machining information is provided for guidance only. International Truck and Engine Corporation assumes no responsibility either for the results of any work performed in accordance with this information or for the ability of service personnel to detect heat cracks.

Carefully examine the flywheel for any cracks or heat checks. If there is any question, discard the flywheel. Any crack or heat check in the flywheel could cause it to separate. Should separation occur, the operator or bystanders may be injured.

If the flywheel is machinable, be sure to recheck the flywheel for cracks and heat checks after it has been machined. If any cracks or heat checks are detected, replace the resurfaced flywheel with a new one.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure

para.emph: The following is provided for your information.

svcproc.para:
Flywheels used in manual transmission vehicles with T 444E Engines may be ground to a minimum thickness of 1.768 inches (44.907 mm). Resurfacing should only be done to correct minor wear and scoring. Before resurfacing the flywheel, determine whether or not it was previously resurfaced, or has adequate stock for resurfacing. To make this determination

NOTE:

svcproc.title: CLEANING
svcproc.para: Clean the flywheel with a non-caustic solvent. Dry it with compressed air.

step1.para: Visually inspect the flywheel for cracks, heat checks, and extensive scoring, which would make it unfit for further service. Replace or resurface the flywheel as required.
Inspect ring gear for worn, chipped, or cracked, teeth. If the teeth are damaged, replace the ring gear.

svcproc.title: Repair (For Manual Transmissions ONly)
svcproc.para:
The flywheel may be ground to correct minor wear and scoring. Do not grind beyond the minimum permissible thickness of 1.768 inches (44.907 mm). Replace the flywheel if it is not repairable by surface grinding.
.

Dimension "A" Flywheel mounting face to flywheel clutch face New flywheels have a thickness of 1.804 inches plus or minus .010 inches (45.822 mm plus or minus 0.254 mm).
1.768 inches (44.907 mm) is the minimum thickness permissible after resurfacing.

svcproc.title: Post-Machining Flywheel inspection
svcproc.para: Once the flywheel has been machined, recheck it for cracks and heat checks. If any cracks or heat checks are detected, replace the resurfaced flywheel with a new one.
